abstract: Preliminary estimates show that the World Series attracted more viewers than an N.F.L. game on Sunday night.
snippet: Preliminary estimates show that the World Series attracted more viewers than an N.F.L. game on Sunday night.
lead_paragraph: Perhaps it was the 62-7 score, or the increased competition from other networks or an overall lack of interest in a match-up - a rematch of Super Bowl XLIV - between the New Orleans Saints and a Peyton Manning-less Indianapolis Colts team. Whatever the reason, preliminary estimates from Nielsen suggest that "Sunday Night Football" on NBC posted its lowest rating in nearly three years. It was not the No. 1 program of the night in total viewers or in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic. That claim goes to Game 4 of the World Series, in which the Texas Rangers defeated the St. Louis Cardinals, 4-0. That baseball game averaged 15.2 million total viewers.

headline.main: For a Night, Baseball Beats Football in the Ratings
